title: The Residence of Sri Nityananda Prabhu | Sri Jai Chaitanya Dasa | Sri Gaura Mandala Parikrama 2024
speaker: HG Jai Chaitanya Dasa

segments.key_quote: residents of lord nithyananda prabhu at kardaha we saw a house
segments.summary: The speaker introduces the topic of Lord Nityananda Prabhu's residence in Kardaha.

segments.key_quote: shri nithyananda prabhu is none other than lord balram the first expansion of the supreme
segments.summary: The speaker explains that Nityananda Prabhu is an incarnation of Lord Balarama and Sri Chaitanya is an incarnation of Lord Krishna.

segments.key_quote: lord chaitanya had entrusted the preaching of bengal under the leadership of merciful nithai
segments.summary: The speaker describes how Nityananda Prabhu was ordered by Lord Chaitanya to marry and preach in Bengal.

segments.key_quote: Shri Bhirachandraprabhu was none other than Shirodakshayi Vishnu, who manifests as the super soul in all of our hearts
segments.summary: The speaker explains the identities of Nityananda Prabhu's family members as incarnations of other deities.

segments.key_quote: A huge mass of land suddenly appeared from the water
segments.summary: The speaker narrates the story of how Nityananda Prabhu acquired land in Kardaha through a miracle after being rebuked by a local Zamindar.

segments.key_quote: All the previous seven sons of Nithyananda Prabhu had died because Sri Abhirama Thakur had paid them his dhandavats.
segments.summary: The speaker describes Kunjavatika and the story of Abhirama Thakur's powerful blessings and Nityananda Prabhu's fear for his son Bhirachandra.

segments.key_quote: But Abhirama then simply spread his grace and said, And then, sitting on that floating cloth, peacefully crossed over the river.
segments.summary: The speaker continues the story of Abhirama Thakur, describing his miraculous crossing of the Ganges and his eventual blessing of Bhirachandra.

segments.key_quote: Lord Nithya was almost completely devoid of any external consciousness and remained intoxicated in an ecstatic love of God.
segments.summary: The speaker concludes by glorifying Nityananda Prabhu's magnanimity, ecstatic love, and the pastimes performed in Kardaha.
